The setting in the cold and snow covered mountains is out of this world magnificent.   But it is also a cruel and unforgiving environment, amplifying the loneliness of its inhabitants.   In an area the size of Rhode Island, there are only 6 tribal police officers.  Not surprisingly, the misfits, the druggies, the perpetually drunk and other miscreants can hide in their isolated trailers and do whatever they want ---- or think they can.  But a moment of lust and alcohol-fueled conflict leads to murderous crimes.  It is the job of the main characters played excellently by Jeremy Renner and Elizabeth Olsen to finally bring some measure of justice and peace.

Inspired by true events, Wind River vividly portrays the injustice faced by murdered and missing Indigenous women. Excellent character work and bleak snow-bound setting, the pain of loss and grief empathically felt, make this so much more than just a murder-mystery action tale. You'll want to see it more than once...
